title: Netflix Stock Has a History of Bouncing Back on Subscriber Data. It May Do It Again.
text:
The stakes are high for Netflix when it reports third-quarter earnings on Wednesday, as Disney+ is set to launch next month and other rival streaming services are buying rights to popular television shows. There will be additional scrutiny of paid subscriber growth, particularly after Netflix said it added 2.7 million new subscriptions in the second quarter, falling short of its guidance for 5 million. Netflix (ticker: NFLX) has bounced back from subscriber misses before. An analyst at Imperial Capital expects history to repeat itself.

...
description: When Netflix missed subscriber estimates in the second quarters of 2016 and 2018, they beat expectations in the respective third quarters.
